newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Share trade to resume in Portugal's BFE.
newsitem.headline: Share trade to resume in Portugal's BFE.

text.p: Share trade will resume in Banco de Fomento & Exterior SA on Friday after a 24-hour suspension, bourse officials said.
The stock was suspended on Thursday at 2,545 escudos.
The shares were being readmitted after the government announced on Thursday that Banco Portugues de Investimento had won the battle to take over BFE which is being privatised.
Although no price has yet been announced for the takeover, dealers expect it to be lower than the current market price.
The share price had been driven up by hopes that the tussle for BFE, in which BPI initially faced two rivals, would be resolved in a competive bid.
But the proposals made by Banco Finantia and Banco Nacional de Credito Imobiliario were rejected by a selection jury without the value of the respective bids being considered.
The minimum bid permitted was 1,980 escudos ($12.94) per share.
